p: We used a broad definition of the term ‘biological security’ in the development of these research questions, in line with the definition outlined in the UK Biological Security Strategy. That is, the protection of population and economic interests from naturally arising, accidentally occurring or deliberately caused biological risks (particularly significant disease outbreaks). This covers biological risks affecting people, the economy and the environment—whether these arise naturally, from deliberate actions, from unintended release or from the unanticipated consequences of deliberate release [ 5]. It is worth noting that biological security has more specific meanings within several of the disciplines and sectors represented by the workshop participants.
